required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Whey Protein-enriched Nutritional Supplement on Gut Microbiota and Inflammatory Status, in Patients Attending a Cardiac Rehabilitation Program

brief_summary.textblock:
In this randomized trial the primary outcome is to assess if high doses of whey protein supplement may lower pro-inflammatory interleukin 6 (IL-6).
Hypothesis: Secondary outcomes are to assess if high doses of whey protein supplement may lower pro-inflammatory interleukin 1β (IL-1 β), tumor necrosis factor and C Reactive Protein (CRP); may increase anti-inflammatory interleukin 10 (IL-10) plasma concentrations and may change Gut Microbiota (GM) composition.

primary_outcome.description: Change in IL-6 [Time Frame: after 15 days (T1) from baseline (T0)]

secondary_outcome.description: Change in IL-1β [Time Frame: after 15 days (T1) from baseline (T0)]
Change in TNF [Time Frame: after 15 days (T1) from baseline (T0)]
Change in CRP [Time Frame: after 15 days (T1) from baseline (T0)]
Change in IL-10 [Time Frame: after 15 days (T1) from baseline (T0)]
Change in GM [Time Frame: after 15 days (T1) from baseline (T0)]

arm_group.description: Standard hospital diet + 80 g/die (two servings) of whey protein-enriched nutritional supplement dissolved in 125 ml of water

intervention.description: Standard hospital diet + 80 g/die (two servings) of whey protein-enriched nutritional supplement dissolved in 125 ml of water

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Admission for cardiac rehabilitation
- Signed informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient unable to eat orally
- Eating disorders
- Indication to Levodopa therapy
- Gastrointestinal malignant diseases
- Known kidney failure
- Known liver failure
- Previous antibiotic therapy
- Refusal
